metadata.name: Uncommon AppX Package Locations
metadata.comment: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in uncommon locations

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM scheduled_job_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (metadata.event_code = 854 AND NOT (contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\\\program files\\\\windowsapps\\\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\\\program files (x86)\\\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\systemapps\\\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\printdialog\\\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\immersivecontrolpanel\\\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('x-windowsupdate://')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('file:///c:/program%20files')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('https://statics.teams.cdn.live.net/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('https://statics.teams.cdn.office.net/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('microsoft.com')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('https://installer.teams.static.microsoft/'))))

output.summary: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in uncommon locations

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown References: Internal Research, https://www.sentinelone.com/labs/inside-malicious-windows-apps-for-malware-deployment/, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/appxpkg/troubleshooting, https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2021/11/11/bazarloader-call-me-back-attack-abuses-windows-10-apps-mechanism/
